pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:0.5: 30. The training rule on what is intended
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.2: At that time an association had prepared a meal together with robes for the Sangha,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.3: intending to offer the robes after giving the meal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.4: But the monks from the group of six went to that association
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.8: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robes for the Sangha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.9: “The Sangha has many donors and supporters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.10: But since we’re staying here, we look to you for support.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.11: If you don’t give to us, then who will?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.13: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robes to them and served the food to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.14: The monks who knew that a meal together with robes had been prepared for the Sangha, but who did not know that the robes had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.17: The robes we had prepared were diverted by the monks from the group of six to themselves.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.18: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.19: “How can the monks from the group of six divert to themselves things they know were intended for the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.20: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.21: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.24: “… Foolish men, how can you divert to yourselves things that you know were intended for the Sangha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.25: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.26: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.27.1: ‘If a monk diverts to himself material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.6: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.8: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.13: If he diverts it to himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.14: When he gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.15: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.16: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.17: (To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5--3.2.29), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.18: ‘Venerables, this thing which I diverted to myself knowing that it was intended for the Sangha is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.19: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.23.1: If it is intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.24: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.25: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.26: If it is intended for one Sangha and he diverts it to another Sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.27: If it is intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a sangha or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.28: If it is intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.29: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.30: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.31: If it is not intended for the Sangha and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.33: if being asked, “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift goes toward equipment” “… where it goes toward repairs” “… where it will last for a long time” “… where you feel inspired;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.35: if he is the first offender.
